Bash(cd "/Users/kokoaung/Desktop/App Launch OS" && git add src/app/api/waitlist/route.ts src/components/WaitlistForm.tsx && git commit -m "$\(cat <<'EOF'
Replace Netlify Forms with Next.js API route + Resend email

Netlify Forms returned 404 on /__forms.html because the @netlify/plugin-nextjs
OpenNext adapter routes all requests through the Next.js runtime, bypassing
Netlify's CDN-level form interceptor.

- Add src/app/api/waitlist/route.ts: validates with Zod, sends email via Resend
- Update WaitlistForm.tsx to POST JSON to /api/waitlist instead of /__forms.html
- Remove unused encode\(\) helper and honeypot div

Env vars to set in Netlify dashboard:
  RESEND_API_KEY      – from resend.com \(free tier: 3k emails/mo\)
  NOTIFICATION_EMAIL  – where to receive signup alerts
  FROM_EMAIL          – optional sender address \(defaults to waitlist@resend.dev\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(cd "/Users/kokoaung/Desktop/App Launch OS" && git add src/app/page.tsx src/app/api/waitlist/route.ts && git commit -m "$\(cat <<'EOF'
Fix Netlify Forms: detection form in static HTML + server-side proxy

Two-part fix for Netlify Forms not receiving submissions with Next.js 16 + OpenNext:

1. page.tsx: Add hidden form with data-netlify="true" directly in the
   statically prerendered page so Netlify's build bot detects and registers
   the "waitlist" form during the build scan.

2. api/waitlist/route.ts: Proxy submissions server-side using process.env.URL
   \(Netlify's built-in site URL var\). Server-side fetches exit through
   Netlify's CDN, which intercepts the POST to /__forms.html and saves
   it under Forms — bypassing the OpenNext client-side routing issue.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)" && git push origin main 2>&1)
